reviews.text: I spent 5 nights at the Kona Bali Kai with my mom and brother. I wish we had booked for longer, because we were all very sorry to leave such a beautiful place.
reviews.title: Geat location, Great value!

likes.liked: — location, view, convenience -- it is a home away from home

reviews.text: I booked a one-bedroom mountain view apartment, but was upgraded to a one-bedroom ocean front apartment. It had two bathrooms, a balcony with a breathtaking view, a full kitchen, washer & dryer, dishwasher, and everything that we forgot to bring with us -- books, beach chairs, beach umbrallers, a cooler, VCR, CD player, etc. It really felt like home, and was exactly what we had wished for. The balcony was so large that it still had plenty of room after placing a round dining table and two relining chairs in it. I used it as a bedroom/study -- I liked to look at the beautiful seaside and listen to the waves while I work. We could see sea turtles right from our balcony. The sunset view was breathtaking.
reviews.title: Great Value!

likes.liked: — The view from our lanai in #413 was incredible!

reviews.text: The location is also amazing. It is on the west coast, very near some of the best snorkeling bays. In fact, you can just swim and snorkel at the seaside right beside the apartment building. It is also a few minutes drive to the couple of shopping centers in Kona.
reviews.title: KBK Fills the Bill for great inexpensive lodging!

likes.disliked: — not real fancy, but I went there for the island outdoors, not the fancy hotel and expense

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are vacationing or want to spend your honeymoon on the Big Island, I would definitely recommend Kona Bali Kai. It is so much better than the 5-star hotels and resorts at the northwestern part of the island.
reviews.title: Fantastic Ocean View

likes.liked: — The ocean view, sounds of the ocean, and the oceam breezes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I took our grandson, Matthew, to Hawaii for his 12th birthday. First, we played total tourist in Waikiki for five days. Then, we headed to Kona to spend nine days at the Kona Bali Kai. I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews, but everything was just fine. We had a wonderful time!!
reviews.title: Don't stay on the street side.

reviews.text: Compared to the regular Kona hotels, this condo complex is a super deal. The furnishings are comfortable Hawaiian rattan, and there are full kitchen facilities. It's just like staying at a clean friend's house AND you get privacy and housekeeping service! The location is good, and there's even beach access. This is a perfect place for a low-key, low-cost Hawaiian getaway.
reviews.title: Super deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was nice, ocean vews are great, nice pool, near great snorkeling beach, Third floor views are exceptional, but no elevator in building 3, travel light. Bed was very uncomfortable.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was ok. rooms were big and clean but overall hotel looks very shabby from outside. There is an expedia person sitting in the lobby so good for booking end moment sightseeings.
reviews.title: ok hotel
They Gave Me a Room without a working Toilet
reviews.text: People complain of cockcroaches in this place but I only saw a wall lizard. I stayed for one day so managed but it would have been difficult. pool was nice but could not use it. beach is right outside the hotel so you can park the car and take few steps and will be standing on sand/rocks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The title says it all. We reserved a room via Hotwire and arrived at 3PM. When we got to the room, it was REALLY run down and it was situated above some long term residents in the facility across the street from the main lobby.
reviews.title: It really wasn't bad!

likes.liked: — It was convienant to downtown Lona ( only 10 minute drive)
likes.disliked: — The rudeness of the staff, the only seemed nice we checked out!

reviews.text: We stayed at the KBK for 7 nights and had a fantastic time! The property location is wonderful - close enough to town, yet far enough away from the crowds on the main drag. We had the most beautiful ocean front view possible with the waves crashing a mere 50 ft from our lanai. The unit was nicely decorated and very well maintained with plenty of linens and basic cleaning supplies. They even provided snorkel gear, cooler and beach towels as well as sand toys and a booster seat for our toddler! The staff was very helpful - especially when my husband was stung by a sea urchin. I highly recommend staying here and we hope to stay again next time we visit Kona.
reviews.title: A great place to stay!

reviews.text: We have stayed 4 different times, for a week each, on the ocean side of the complex. The views of the waves, in case you cannot guess, are outstanding. It is pure pleasure to grill out by the ocean and then eat on the "lanai" or porch. It is so easy to shop at Costco, make exceptional meals for the whole family, and eat OCEAN FRONT for all times. The units are spacious, well appointed, at least 218 is, and just perfect .
reviews.title: View, view, view, Just perfect!

likes.liked: — The View of the ocean and turtles.
likes.disliked: — One must drive to get to a nice beach.

reviews.text: From my point of view, this is an an excellent place to sty and a great value.
reviews.title: Good value!

likes.liked: — Great waterfront views from the huge lanai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would insist on an ocean front unit and, if possible, rent from an owner not the front desk.
reviews.title: Too much road noise

likes.liked: — Clean comfortable unit at a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a week and were pleased with the value. On the advice of other travellers we booked a waterfront 1 bedroom, and were upgraded without any extra charge to a waterfront 2-bedroom, 2 bathroom unit, on the third floor with a huge lanai. The condo is older but the spaces are big and the kitchen was fully equipped. We found the people at the front desk pleasant and helpful. Our dishwasher stopped draining properly and maintainance were there within the morning to fix it. There is a Costco just south of the airport where we stocked up for the week, and grilled fresh fish or steak every night on the communal BBQ.
reviews.title: Great Condo with ocean view!

reviews.text: The ocean view is fabulous--saw dophins and excellent surfers off our patio. But the noise from the ocean was like the Niagara Falls, even with patio windows closed. Our unit did not have air conditioning--owner assured us it was not needed with ocean breezes. Wrong. I would not rent again without a/c in the unit.
reviews.title: Ocean view vs. good night's sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is surrounded by high walls, so it is like an echo chamber when the kids are just having fun. The pool does not get much sun either. We also saw cockroaches, and there were several things that did not work in the unit. Although the complex has "no smoking" signs, there were smokers in unit below us and complaints to the management did not stop this annoyance.
reviews.title: KBK 272 A very nice retreat

reviews.text: Next time, we would take our chances with a different complex.
reviews.title: Wow, the ocean view unit was just awseome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another great stay at Kona Bali Kai. We have enjoyed this particular owner condo a couple of times now. It just gets more comfortable. Excellent staff support
reviews.title: Check out the Kona Bail Kai

reviews.text: We stayed at a privately owned, privately rented unit with an ocean view. It was awesome. The owner was completely honest about the unit and it was exactly what we were expecting from the description given. The place was well maintenanced, clean, politely staffed, nice location not too far or too close to town. Way to go!!!!
reviews.title: Nearly the best view ever!

likes.liked: — The view and the fully-equipped kitchen
likes.disliked: — No in-unit washer & dryer, and distance to beaches
